BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.Title: Bootstrap Blazor enterprise-level UI component library
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.HeaderTitle: Bootstrap style Blazor UI component library
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.HeaderDesc: Based on the Bootstrap style library, it is carefully built, and {0} a variety of commonly used components have been added to bring you an extraordinary feeling for rapid development projects
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.HeaderBody1: native Blazor components library on the market
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.CarouselP1: Provide a variety of commonly used chart components
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.CarouselP3: With all functions of adding, deleting, modifying, searching, paging, and sorting
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.ContainerD1: This set of components library contains more than {0} multiple components, from simple buttons to complex page-level components
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.ContainerD2: Each control has been fine-tuned to optimize the refresh logic between parent and child components to avoid multiple loop updates
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.ContainerD3: Easily grasp how to use components and quickly incorporate BootstrapBlazor controls into the project
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.ContainerD4: Simple, direct, free to use, no dependent components, dependent on jQuery Bootstrap are all built-in
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.ContainerD5: Detailed documentation and online demonstration, simple function setting, direct copy code out of the box
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.ContainerD6: Gitee platform hosting open source, never closed source, continuous update, timely response to questions and feedback
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.DonateH2: Scan the code to donate and invite the author to have a cup of coffee

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.Title: Component label
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.P1: This set of components includes ValidateForm EditorForm and a variety of Form components inherited from ValidateBase<TValue>. Among these components There is a special set of display front label logic, now let’s sort it out in a unified way:
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.UlLi1: The ValidateForm component is a verifiable form component. The form component in this component will automatically perform data compliance checks. If Data non-compliance will prevent the Submit action, which is the most frequently used component in data submission
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.UlLi2: The EditorForm component is an ordinary form component. After this component is bound to the Model, the entire form can be automatically generated, which greatly reduces repetition Code, put the ValidateForm on the outside to open the data compliance check very convenient, concise and efficient
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.P2: Take the BootstrapInput input box component as an example to explain whether to display the Label logic
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.Tips: The logic of ShowLabel is the principle of proximity. The closer the setting is to itself, the setting takes effect. For example, the form component is built into the ValidateForm component, even if ValidateForm is set to >ShowLabel=true, when the form component itself sets ShowLabel=false, the final result of the label is not displayed
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.Block1P1: When two-way binding is not used
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.Block1Li1: Label will not be displayed by default
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.Block1Li2: Control whether to display through the ShowLabel property
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.Block1Li4: When not set, render a contentless label component as a placeholder
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.GroupBox1D1: No settings in the first text box, no label
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.GroupBox1D2: The second text box setting ShowLabel='true' DisplayText=`` displays a placeholder label without content
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.GroupBox1D3: The third text box setting ShowLabel='true' DisplayText='Name' shows the set content label
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.GroupBox1D4: The fourth text box setting ShowLabel='true' DisplayText='@@null' displays a placeholder label without content
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.GroupBox2D1: The first text box is set to @@bind-Value='Dummy.Name', no label is displayed
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.GroupBox2D2: The second text box setting @@bind-Value='Dummy.Name' ShowLabel='true' DisplayText='@@Localizer[nameof(Foo.Address)]' Display the contents of the setting
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.GroupBox2D3: The third text box setting @@bind-Value='Dummy.Name' ShowLabel='true' DisplayText=`` Show no content placeholder label
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.GroupBox2D4: The fourth text box setting @@bind-Value='Dummy.Name' ShowLabel='true' DisplayText='@@null' Display the label content under the resource file mechanismLabel code>
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.P4:
Show label
The ShowLabel property of the EditorForm component is not set. If it is not set, it is equivalent to set to true. All components display tags
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.P5:
Do not display labels
Set ShowLabel='false', all form components in the component Do not display tags
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.P6:
Show label
The ShowLabel property of the EditorForm component is not set. If it is not set, it is equivalent to set to true. All components display tags
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.P7:
Do not display labels
Set ShowLabel='false', all form components in the component Do not display tags
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.Block4Intro: Show labels are automatically turned on by default
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.P8:
Show label
The ShowLabel property of the EditorForm component is not set. If it is not set, it is equivalent to set to true. All components display tags
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.P9:
Do not display labels
Set ShowLabel='false', all form components in the component Do not display tags
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Labels.P10:
Show labels
set class form-inline for the all labels within the component are prefixed

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Install.GitP1: There are many kinds of Git tools that everyone is familiar with, here I introduce two Git client tools
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Install.GitP2: It is recommended to use the Fork tool to install, it can better and Visutal Studio to use with development tools.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Install.NugetP1: Use nuget.org to install BootstrapBlazor components
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Install.EnvLi2: Install Visual Studio 2019 and above <a href='https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/vs/getting-started' target='_blank'>Official website
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Install.EnvLi3: Pull the project code BootstrapBlazor Warehouse URL

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Template.Title: Project Template
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Template.SubTitle: Bootstrap Blazor App Template
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Template.P1: In order to make it easier for everyone to use this set of components to quickly build projects, the author has made Project Templates, using dotnet new command line mode, using Proceed as follows:
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Template.P4: After the project is created, the BootstrapBlazorApp solution will be generated in the current folder, and the src directory contains Server-Side Wasm Both types of projects can be run directly with F5
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Template.P6: In order to facilitate the use of the Bootstrap Blazor component library, the author has created the Project Template (Bootstrap Blazor Project Template) extension plug-in, which can be installed through Visual Studio 2019 IDE When creating a new project, select the Bootstrap Blazor project template, and the solution is built in two types: Server-Side and wasm project

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Components..P1: There are many ways to reference components, please refer to Installation
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Components..P2: Add the Bootstrap CSS file in the form of <link> tags to the {0} file <head> tags, and place them in all Before other style sheets.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Components..Tips: After this set of components version 5.0.32 remove the built-in font-awesome icon, please download it yourself or use the CDN acceleration service
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Components..Tips2: If you use the Blazor App template to create a project, please remove the default Bootstrap style link <link rel='stylesheet' href='css/bootstrap/bootstrap .min.css' />
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Components..P3: Many components provided by Bootstrap rely on JavaScript to run. Specifically, these components rely on jQuery, Popper.js, and our own JavaScript plug-ins. Put the following <script> tag at the end of the {0} file and before the </body> tag, it will work.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Components..H4: Add the namespace to the _Imports.razor file
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Components..P4: Reference the BootstrapBlazor component in the razor component

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.Title: Dividing line
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.H1: The dividing line that separates the content.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.Block1Intro: Split text paragraphs in different chapters.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.P1: Youth is a short dream, when you wake up, it has long since disappeared.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.P2: A small amount of evil is enough to cancel out all the noble qualities, causing people to be infamous.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.Block2Intro: You can customize the content of the copy on the dividing line.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.P3: A sunny day above my head, I missed one in my heart
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.P4: When the knight returns, the day the broken sword is reforged
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.Block3Intro: You can customize the content of the copy on the dividing line.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.Block5Intro: Any content can be customized by setting the content of ChildContent
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.Div: I am a custom content div element
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.Desc1: Set the split line to display text
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.Desc2: Set the split line display icon
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.Desc3: Set the split line display text alignment
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Dividers.Desc4: Set whether the dividing line is vertical division

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Scrolls.Title: Scroll
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Scrolls.H1: Add scroll bars to components whose height or width exceeds the standard
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Scrolls.P1: The scroll bar can be rendered only when its element has a fixed height. Its height attribute can be set through the coat element
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Scrolls.Block1Intro: Add a scroll bar to the component. By setting the height of Height to 200px, the scroll bar appears when the height of the inner child element is 400px
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Scrolls.D1: Please scroll the scroll bar on the right

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Title: Layout
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.H1: The container component used for layout, which is convenient to quickly build the basic structure of the page:
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Code1: Outer container. When the child element contains Header or Footer, all child elements will be arranged vertically up and down, otherwise they will be arranged horizontally.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Code6: Layout container, Header Sider Main Footer or Layout itself can be nested under it , Can be placed in any parent container
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Code7: Top layout, with default style, any elements can be nested under it
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Code8: Sidebar, with default style and basic functions, any elements can be nested under it
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Code9: The content part, with its own default style, any element can be nested under it
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Code10: Bottom layout, with default style, any element can be nested under it
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.P1: The above components adopt flex layout, please make sure the target browser is compatible before using. In addition, the child element of Layout can only be the latter four, and the parent element of the latter four can only be Layout
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.P2: In order to make it easy for everyone to use this set of components to quickly build projects, the author has created Project Templates, using the dotnet new command line, and < code>Bootstrap Blazor App Extension extension plug-in Create a new project through Visual Studio 2019. For specific usage and steps, please click Portal< /a>
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Block1Intro: Commonly found in Internet website layout
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Block2Title: Left and right structural layout in the middle
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Block2Intro: The middle part adopts the left and right structure, which is mostly used for back-end management website layout. When the Side component is added to the layout template, the upper middle and lower parts are used by default, and the middle part adopts the left and right structure layout.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Block3Intro: The right side adopts an upper, middle and lower structure, which is mostly used for back-end management of the website layout, and the layout is controlled to the left and right structure by setting the IsFullSide attribute value
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Block4Intro: The width of the sidebar is controlled by setting the SideWidth property, which supports percentage writing. When setting 0, the width setting function is turned off, and the internal sub-controls are used to fill the width feature
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.D1: In actual use, the sidebar generally has two uses
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.D2: The sidebar fills the entire screen, and scroll bars appear when the overall height of the menu exceeds the screen
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.D3: The sidebar is not processed and the height is automatically opened by the content
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.D4: Because there are many ways to use it, this component is not packaged, and it is up to you to decide how to carry out the layout. The following is a practical example in actual use
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.P3: In order to facilitate your study and comparison, try to use the style inline style in the following practical examples
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.P4: In this example, a scroll bar appears after clicking the menu on the left to expand
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Tips1: The available area in the right panel is all by default, which is suitable for layouts with Tab components. In this example, for the sake of beauty, the Main template has a built-in div And set the style to style='padding: 1rem;'
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.P5: In this example, if the scroll bar does not appear after clicking the left menu to expand, the height of the parent container will be expanded
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.P6: Please refer to Tab component for practical examples of using Layout component and Tab component together
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Tips2: By setting the IsPage property to set whether the Layout component controls the layout of the front page level, after setting it to true, the component adopts the full-screen layout
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Desc3: Sidebar width, support percentage, turn off the width function when set to 0
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Desc6: Sidebar menu data collection when the whole page is laid out
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Desc7: Whether the sidebar occupies the entire left
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Desc8: Whether it is the whole page layout
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Desc9: Whether to fix the Footer component
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Desc10: Whether to fix the Header component
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Desc11: Whether to show contraction and expansion Bar
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Desc13: Whether to display the back to top button
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Desc15: Collection of additional programs, passed to the Tab component for use
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Layouts.Desc17: Call back the delegate when the menu item is clicked

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Footers.Title: Footer
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Footers.H1: Displayed at the bottom of the page, with a back to top button
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Footers.P1: When using Footer components, pay attention to the setting of the style sheet position attribute
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Footers.BlockIntro: Pass the ID of the scroll bar component to the footer component
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Footers.P2: The Footer component is displayed at the bottom, and the page will automatically scroll back to the top when you click to return to the top
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Footers.P3: This example passes the component client ID
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Footers.Desc1: The text displayed by the footer component
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Footers.Desc2: The ID of the scroll bar component controlled by the footer component

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Rows.Title: Row
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Rows.H1: The number of components displayed in a row can be easily set
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Rows.Block2Intro: When placing form controls, you can specify RowType as Inline, and Label will be displayed on the left, and the control will fill the remaining space
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Rows.Block3Intro: When placing form controls, you can specify RowType as FormRow, and Label will be displayed on the top, and the control will be full
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Rows.P1: In this example, the Row component is built into the ValidateForm component, and the front Label tag is automatically added
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Rows.Block4Intro: The Row component supports nested use. For example, the outermost Row below sets a row to display two controls, the first is TextBox, the second One is still Row, and the second Row continues to be set to display two controls
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Rows.Block5Intro: The Row component can set the number of spanning columns by specifying the ColSpan value. Combining these functions can achieve complex layouts
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Rows.b5: Row shows 4, the second component ColSpan is set to 3
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Rows.b6: Row shows 2, the first component ColSpan is set to 3
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Rows.Desc1: Set a row to display several controls
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Rows.Desc2: Set the layout format, if the child Row is not specified, the parent Row’s settings will be used
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Rows.Desc3: Set the number of columns of child Row across parent Row
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Rows.Desc4: Set the maximum number of controls displayed in a row

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Skeletons.Title: Skeleton
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Skeletons.H1: Provide a placeholder graphic combination where you need to wait for content to load
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Skeletons.Li1: When the network is slow and it takes a long time to wait for the loading process
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Skeletons.Li2: Lists/cards with more graphic information content
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Skeletons.Li3: Only used when loading data for the first time
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Skeletons.Li4: Can be completely replaced by Spin, but can provide better visual effects and user experience than Spin in available scenarios
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Skeletons.Block1Intro: Suitable for display when loading avatars, pictures, etc.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Skeletons.P1: It can be set to a circle display by setting the Circle property
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Skeletons.Block2Intro: Applicable to display when loading large paragraphs of text and other types
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Skeletons.P2: The default paragraph skeleton screen only displays three lines. If you need multiple lines to occupy space, please place multiple SkeletonParagraph.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Skeletons.Block3Intro: Suitable for display when the edit form is loaded
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Skeletons.Block4Intro: Applicable to display when the edit table is loaded

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.GlobalExcep.Title: Global exception
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.GlobalExcep.P1: Added component BlazorLogger Through this component, global logs and exceptions can be output uniformly; currently, the Blazor framework does not provide a MVC like < b>Global exception The overall solution, for the time being, you need to use try/catch in the code block for exception capture
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.GlobalExcep.P2: 1. Add AddLogging to the Startup file to enable the net core system log function
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.GlobalExcep.P3: 2. Use BlazorLogger to wrap the content, such as: Body in MainLayout
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.GlobalExcep.P4: 3. Use cascading parameters in the code to get examples
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.GlobalExcep.P5: 4. Console or IIS output visible log information
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.GlobalExcep.Block1Intro: This function is to obtain the component instance through the cascade parameter and use its function
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.GlobalExcep.P6: In this example code, an error code that divides by zero is written. Because try/catch is used to capture the exception, the error message is displayed in the console below

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.Title: Introduction
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.P1: BootstrapBlazor is an enterprise-level component library based on Bootstrap and Blazor, which can be considered as the Blazor version of the Bootstrap project.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.P3: In the latest Project Template ,the above dependencies are packaged and bundled, which greatly simplifies use
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.P4: This component may be released every day beta version, every Thursday release official version Update log
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.LearnLi2: Use Blazor WebAssembly and Visual Studio Code to generate web applications
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.P5: The largest code hosting collaborative development platform in China Gitee C# The highest star in the sector Works Universal background management system BootstrapAdmin Ready to use this component to achieve all functions
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.P6: The Bootstrap Blazor UI component library provides everything from basic Button components to advanced web-level SmartPage components
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.AdvantageLi1: No need to write Javascript to use components
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.AdvantageLi3: The component supports two-way data binding

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Components..Welcome: Welcome to join the group discussion
